body_html:
This does seem to be an issue in pytorch as best as we can tell - FDs aren't being released when they should be. As @sampathweb mentioned, it's reproducible using the above code. The workaround for now is:

import resource
rlimit = resource.getrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE)
resource.setrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE, (2048, rlimit[1]))

(You may need to set 2048 to a higher number.)

body:
This does seem to be an issue in pytorch as best as we can tell - FDs aren't being released when they should be. As @sampathweb mentioned, it's reproducible using the above code. The workaround for now is:

```
import resource
rlimit = resource.getrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE)
resource.setrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE, (2048, rlimit[1]))
```
(You may need to set 2048 to a higher number.)
